explanations.a: The coffiecients in Bmn are related to loss calculations.
explanations.b: The coffiecients in Bmn are related to loss calculations.
explanations.c: The coffiecients in Bmn are related to loss calculations.

questions.question: Which of the following factor is used to move one optimal schedule to another when load changes are small?

explanations.a: Base point factor is not used in the case of small load changes.
explanations.b: Maximum point factor is not used in the case of small load changes.
explanations.c: Penalty factor is not used in the case of small load changes.
explanations.d: For small changes in load optimal schedule is achived by using participation factor.

questions.question: The term 'transmission loss' refers to the loss of

answers.a: Equal value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists
answers.b: Different value of inductive reactance and capacitance reactance of the transmission line, only resistance exists
answers.c: Square root of ratio of the inductive reactance to capacitance reactance of the transmission line
answers.d: Square root of ratio of the capacitive reactance to inductive reactance of the transmission line

explanations.a: Only real power loss is considered in the case of transmission lines. The reactive components cancel each other out.
explanations.b: The reactive component must cancel each other out incase of transmission losses.
explanations.c: The reactive component must cancel each other out incase of transmission losses.
explanations.d: The reactive component must cancel each other out incase of transmission losses.

explanations.d: Refer and Revise the formulae for the loss coffecients.

questions.question: The derivation of transmission line loss is not based on which assumption?

answers.a: All the load currents maintain a constant ratio.
answers.b: All the lines in the system have different X/R ratios.
answers.c: All the load currents have same phase angle.
answers.d: The power factor at each station remains constant.

explanations.a: The constant ratio maintained by all the load currents is required in the derivation of transmission line loss.
explanations.b: The X/R ratios is required in the derivation of transmission line loss.
explanations.c: The phase angle of the load currents does not affect the derivation of transmission line loss.
explanations.d: Constant power factor is a must in derivation of of transmission line loss.
